library(dplyr)

Code
library(ggplot2)
library(dbplyr)



Attaching package: 'dbplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:dplyr':

    ident, sql


Code
con <- DBI::dbConnect(
  duckdb::duckdb(), 
  dbdir = "my-db.duckdb"
  )
df <- dplyr::tbl(con, "penguins")




Code
df %>%
  group_by(species, sex) %>%
  summarise(
    across(
        ends_with("mm") | ends_with("g"),
      \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)
      )
    ) %>%
  dplyr::collect() %>%
  knitr::kable()


`summarise()` has grouped output by "species". You can override using the
`.groups` argument.

title: Penguins EDA
section: Penguin Size vs Mass by Species
text:
Penguin Size vs Mass by Species


Code
df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = species)) +
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'


Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_smooth()`).


Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).







Code
DBI::dbDisconnect(con, shutdown = TRUE)

title: Model
text:
Code
from pandas import get_dummies
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn import preprocessing

title: Model
text:
Get Data


Code
import duckdb
con = duckdb.connect('my-db.duckdb')
df = con.execute("SELECT * FROM penguins").fetchdf().dropna()
con.close()

df.head(3)

title: Model
text:
Define Model and Fit


Code
X = get_dummies(df[['bill_length_mm', 'species', 'sex']], drop_first = True)
y = df['body_mass_g']

model = LinearRegression().fit(X, y)

title: Model
text:
Get some information


Code
print(f"R^2 {model.score(X,y)}")
print(f"Intercept {model.intercept_}")
print(f"Columns {X.columns}")
print(f"Coefficients {model.coef_}")


R^2 0.8555368759537614
Intercept 2169.269720939398
Columns Index(['bill_length_mm', 'species_Chinstrap', 'species_Gentoo', 'sex_male'], dtype='object')
Coefficients [  32.53688677 -298.76553447 1094.86739145  547.36692408]

title: Model
text:
Turn into Vetiver Model


Code
from vetiver import VetiverModel, VetiverAPI
from pins import board_temp

v = VetiverModel(model, model_name='penguin_model', prototype_data=X)

title: Model
text:
Load Environment


Code
from dotenv import load_dotenv

load_dotenv()


False

title: Model
text:
Write to S3


Code
from pins import board_s3
from vetiver import vetiver_pin_write

board = board_s3("do4ds-lab", allow_pickle_read=True)
vetiver_pin_write(board, v)
